instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2338: What is A2338? A2338 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2020 M1, Mid 2022 M2 with EMC 8162, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02020, 820-02773..

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Water Damage
threads.message:
Hello,
I have a Macbook Pro that came in for no touch bar.
The board had corosion but no shorts.
Cleaned up the board and put it back.

Checked with another chasis to confirm that it is a faulty touch bar issue.

But the machine as a weird problem with the sleep sensor. If we put the flap down, the light doesnt go off. And then if we put the flap back up the machine hangs - the cursor moves and presses but the apps are unresponsive.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Water Damage
threads.message:
I bet you have corroded lid angle sensors.
Check JR200/1 and UR200 signals.

If you need to replace any, watch this:
[MEDIA=youtube]<SIGNAL>LXO6L_WHDEE</SIGNAL>[/MEDIA]

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Water Damage
threads.message:
Checked with just the board on the table.

<SIGNAL>AMR_RIGHT_OR_ND_1V8</SIGNAL> IS 0.9V
<SIGNAL>AMR_LEFT_OR_ND_1V8</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>IPD_LID_OPEN_R_1V8</SIGNAL> IS 1.8V

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Water Damage
threads.message: <SIGNAL>AMR_RIGHT_OR_ND_1V8</SIGNAL> must be high, if JR201 is not connected; unless RR201 is bad.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Water Damage
threads.message:
DIODE MODE READINGS on RR2201

Pin #1 is .290
Pin #2 is .400

Getting 1.8V on Pin 1 and 0.9V on Pin 2

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Water Damage
threads.message: Replaces RR201 but its still the same.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Water Damage
Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Water Damage
threads.message: You mean to remove the connector from the board - JR900 ?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Water Damage
threads.message:
The connector from the board???
Why not disconnect the audio flex only?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Water Damage
threads.message: Its just the raw board that i am testing. The Audio board and flex isnâ€™t connected. The above readings are of the main board.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Water Damage
threads.message:
Something pulls down the signal.
May have corrosion under JR900, UR200, or M1 chip.

Try forcing the signal with 100-10K, instead of 1M (in place of RR201).

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Water Damage
threads.message: Amazing !! Its working fine now. Even the touchbar is back on. This is crazyyyyy.
